description: Demolition of cinema and redevelopment to provide part 4, part 5 and part 6 storey building, comprising a mixed use development of ground and part first floor offices and ancillary uses for Ealing Voluntary Services Council with 34 flats, two sleepover rooms for guests, communal laundry and meeting room (first to fifth floors) and vehicle access and parking for two pool cars, bin and cycle storage and landscaping
decision_conditions: Notwithstanding the design shown on the submitted drawings, detailed drawings for all elevations to include: 1) A redesign of the front elevations  I. all external materials II. design of the balustrades III. design of windows  IV. ground floor office frontage V. the vehicular entrances and residential entrance areas to show inward opening doors 2) and for the rear elevation  I. all external materials II. design of windows to show measures to mitigate against overlooking   shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be carried out only in accordance with such details as are approved pursuant to this condition and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure the appearance of the building harmonises with the locality and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with adopted policies B1, B5, B24, ES5 and H33 and replacement policies 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the UDP. | Details of a car pooling system to be operated on the site incorporating the two vehicular spaces, together with a Green Travel Plan to show other measures to be taken, including restrictions on car use through tenancy agreements, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development.  Such measures as approved shall be brought into use prior to first occupation or as set out in the Green Travel Plan, and retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure provision of alternative forms of transport for the occupiers in accordance with replacement UDP policies 9.1 and 9.8. | The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Dustbin and enclosed refuse areas for both residential units and office/community use and, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, shall be sited a maximum distance of 23 metres (10 metres where paladins are employed) from an adopted highway, and a maximum of 25 metres from any dwelling unit intended to use them. Such details as approved shall be implemented before first occupation of the development and thereafter retained.  Reason: To comply with the Council's Design Guides, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B5 & H34; Replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5. | Notwithstanding the information shown in the submitted plans, no development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including measures of litter collection, and including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season. The approved details of measures for litter collection shall be permanently retained. Reason:  In the interests of living conditions of the occupiers of the proposed residential units and the outlook from the adjoining office accommodation in accordance with adopted policies B1, B2, B5, B24, ES2, H34 and H8 and replacement policies 4.1, 4.5, 4.8 and 5.5 of the UDP. | No development shall take place until a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The schedule shall include the details of the arrangement for its implementation. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.  REASON:  To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with adopted policies B1, B2, B5, B24, ES2, H34 and H8 and replacement policies 4.1, 4.5, 4.8 and 5.5 of the UDP. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment, including the height of any existing boundary walls to be retained, fences, gates and accesses to be erected.  Such details as approved shall be carried out before any part of the new development is occupied and retained permanently thereafter.  REASON: In the interests of living conditions of the occupiers of the proposed residential units and the outlook from the adjoining office accommodation in accordance with adopted policies B1, B2, B5, B24, ES2, H34 and H8 and replacement policies 4.1, 4.5, 4.8 and 5.5 of the UDP. | Details shall be submitted prior to first installation to demonstrate that any machinery audible outside the premises will be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding  1. NR35 for plant which will operate during the period of 2300-0700 hrs weekdays and anytime on Saturdays, Sunday and Bank Holidays; (as depicted on the Noise Rating Curves issued by the International Organisation for Standardisation) at any time. 2. NR40 for plant which will is controlled by time switches only to run during the period of 0700-2300 hrs Mondays to Fridays; Measured or calculated at 1.0m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises with all machines running together. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first use and retained as first implemented thereafter in accordance with manufacturers specifications.   Reason: To prevent nuisance to the occupants of adjacent occupiers, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy ES5; Replacement UDP policy 4.11. | Details of access for people with disabilities for the residential and office parts of the proposed building shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before any work is commenced; and the approved scheme shall be implemented before the first occupation of the office and residential accommodation, and shall be permanently retained.   Reason: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B6, ES3, H12; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3. | Details of acoustic separation as follows;  1. Ceiling between the ground floor community offices and first floor residential; 2. Vertical walls between community offices and first floor residential; 3. Floors and ceilings between first floor community offices and second floor residential; Such details shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works and shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the residential parts and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: To prevent noise disturbance and in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the residential element of the proposed building in accordance with adopted policies B5, B8 and ES5 and replacement policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the UDP. | The ground and part first floor accommodation hereby permitted as identified on the plan no.s A2482/2.1/10 and A2482/2.1/11 for Ealing Voluntary Services Council shall only be used as Office/ Community Facilities with Ancillary Uses (meeting room, conference rooms, archive facilities, library, offices) and shall not be used for any other purpose without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the  submission of a planning permission.  REASON: To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable  the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, in the interests of the amenity of the locality in accordance with adopted policies B5, B8 and ES5 and new policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the replacement UDP and to ensure that community facilities are provided in accordance with adopted policies CF3, CF4 and CF5 and replacement policies 8.2. | The hours of operation of the Ealing Voluntary Services Council including the meeting rooms and library and archive facilities shall be restricted to 08:00 to 20:00 Monday to Friday and 0800 to 1300 on Saturdays and not at any time on Sundays or Public Holidays.  Reason: In the interests of living conditions of nearby occupiers in accordance with adopted policies S8, B5, B8 and ES5 and replacement policies 4.1, 4.11 and 7.7. | The land shall be kept clear of obstruction above a height of 0.6m within the 1.5m x 1.5m pedestrian visibility splays at the vehicular entrance on Northfield Avenue as shown on drawing no.s A2482/2.1/10.  Reason: In the interest of highway safety in accordance with adopted policies T62 and new policies 9.1 in the replacement UDP. | No deliveries to the ground and part first floor community facilities (and ancillary uses) shall take place outside the hours of 8am till 6pm on Mondays to Saturdays and not at all on Sundays and Bank Holidays.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the residential parts and of neighbouring properties in accordance with adopted policies B5, B8 and ES5 and replacement policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the UDP. | A scheme for protecting sensitive rooms from external noise shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works and the approved scheme shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: In the interests of the living and working conditions of occupiers of the building in accordance with adopted policies B5, B8, and ES5 replacement policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the UDP. | Before the commencement of any works, details of mechanical ventilation (including any extract ducting) shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to show that fresh air can be obtained when windows are required to be kept shut to block out noise. Details as approved shall be implemented before first use and permanently retained.   REASON: In the interests of the living and working conditions of occupiers of the building and adjoining area in accordance with adopted policies B5, B8, and ES5 replacement policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the UDP. | Prior to commencement of development, details of the design of the building and car/cycle parking area aiming to comply with the requirements of Secure By Design shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy B1, B20, H26 and H27; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.3, 4.4 and 5.5. | Details of all external lighting to be erected, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers "Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution"and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, shall be submitted in writing to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing.  The lighting as approved shall be installed prior to the first occupation and maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter. Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the building and adjoining area in accordance with adopted policies B5, B8, and ES5 replacement policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the UDP. | Details of new vehicular access from Northfield Avenue to include any kerb build outs to ensure adequate sight lines shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works. The approved details shall be constructed before any part of the development permitted is first occupied or brought into use.  REASON:  In the interests of highway safety in accordance with adopted policies T62 and new policies 9.1 in the replacement UDP. | The cycle parking as shown in the approved drawings shall be implemented prior to first occupation and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure there that adequate cycle parking is retained within the site in accordance with adopted policy T46 and replacement policy 9.6. | The layout of the residential units on the upper floors shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved plans, drawing nos.A2482/2.1/11 and A2482/2/1/12 so that there are no living rooms facing the rear of the properties in Chapel Road.   Reason:  To protect the living conditions of the residents of Chapel Road in accordance with adopted UDP policies B5, H33 and replacement UDP policy 5.5.
